pageContext.claim: “Germany has -- they really owe a lot of money in NATO, and this has been going on for many years. When you add it all up, you're probably getting close to a trillion dollars.”
pageContext.analysis: Germany does not owe a trillion dollars to NATO. The voluntary guidelines call on countries to spend at least two percent of its gross domestic product by 2024 on their own defense. It's an arbitrary metric that, paradoxically, is easier to meet if a country's economy is weak. Germany is the strongest economy in Europe.
